title: Source: Commanders to hire Vikes' Jones as DC
content: The Commanders are finalizing a deal to hire Vikings pass game coordinator Daronte Jones as their next defensive coordinator, a source said.

title: No. 1 Arizona survives BYU to stay undefeated
content: Brayden Burries scored 29 points and made the game-saving block in the final seconds as No. 1 Arizona held off a furious rally from No. 13 BYU.

title: Bediako hearing delayed; NCAA wants new judge
content: Charles Bediako can continue playing for Alabama after a hearing on his request for a preliminary injunction was delayed. Meanwhile, the NCAA has filed a motion asking the judge overseeing the case to recuse himself, AL.com reported.

title: Shedeur to replace Maye in Pro Bowl, source says
content: Browns quarterback Shedeur Sanders is being added to the Pro Bowl Games roster, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: ACC moves title game to noon in schedule drop
content: The ACC is moving its conference championship game to noon on Saturday in an effort to draw more attention to the game.

title: Stanford, family of Katie Meyer reach settlement
content: Stanford announced a settlement with the family of Katie Meyer, the former star soccer goalkeeper and two-time team captain who died by suicide in 2022.

title: Ex-FIFA prez backs call to 'stay away' from WC
content: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter on Monday backed a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

title: Ex-Olympian, alleged kingpin, pleads not guilty
content: Former Canadian Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to running a billion-dollar drug trafficking ring and orchestrating multiple killings.

title: Barnwell: What went right for the Seahawks, Patriots -- and wrong for the Rams, Broncos -- on Sunday
content: The Seahawks and Patriots both won one-score conference title games -- but in very different fashions. What did we learn about the Super Bowl-bound teams?

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: The 10 NBA teams that have the most to trade for Giannis
content: If the Bucks open trade talks for Giannis Antetokounmpo, which teams have the players, draft picks and contracts to get a deal done?

title: Inside Sean Payton's fourth-down Patriots-Broncos call
content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona unanimous No. 1, Nebraska at historic No. 5
content: The latest Top 25 poll is out, continuing to feature all three unbeaten teams. What's next for the ranked teams?

title: WWE 'Raw' results: Finn Balor attacks CM Punk, Bron Breakker returns
content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: My first bet for Super Bowl LX: Back Seattle's offense in a high-scoring matchup
content: It's time for the biggest sports betting event of the year. Here's your first betting guide to Super Bowl LX.

title: Lessons from Man United's victory at Arsenal; Real Madrid win ugly; Liverpool woe; more
content: Man United look better post-Ruben Amorim. Can they keep it going? And how quickly can Arsenal move past Sunday's loss? Plus: Real Madrid win ugly and Liverpool continue to suffer, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Does anyone want to win the Premier League?
content: A Man United title triumph is unlikely scenario, but a  12-point gap is nothing in this crazy season.

title: 'Uptown Funk,' 'Creed' and more trends from Seahawks' last Super Bowl berth
content: The Seahawks are headed to the big game for the first time since 2015. Here are the that year's biggest trends.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: What to know about Charles Bediako's TRO extension, more eligibility cases
content: After playing for Alabama over the weekend, Bediako's temporary restraining order was extended and his preliminary injunction hearing postponed.

title: UFC 324 grades: First fight card of the year sets a high bar
content: Five early finishes at UFC 324 were topped by a stellar title fight between Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold
content: Real Madrid's Trent Alexander-Arnold is being targeted for a return to the Premier League with Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Why has Barcelona's best young player left to join PSG?
content: Shortly after turning 18, Dro Fernández shocked the club by joining PSG for a minimal fee. What happened?

title: ‘Accident’ that wasn’t: Bengaluru techie crashes SUV twice to finish off friend
content: A drunken argument between friends escalated into a brutal murder in Electronics City. Roshan Hegde, a software engineer, intentionally crashed his SUV twice, killing his friend Prashanth M who was clinging to the vehicle. Dashcam footage revealed the deliberate act, initially mistaken for a road accident. The dispute stemmed from a cricket match and alcohol consumption.

title: Wheelchair-bound soldier harassed at Karnataka toll plaza; viral video prompts apology
content: Sasthan toll plaza staff apologized after an ex-serviceman, a war casualty, was allegedly harassed over toll payment despite presenting exemption documents. The incident, captured in a viral video, led to staff sensitization by police. The ex-serviceman has not pressed charges.

title: Pakistan-origin player in squad: Scotland confident visas will clear for T20 WC in India
content: Cricket Scotland's CEO is confident players will reach India for the T20 World Cup despite visa delays, especially for Pakistan-origin pacer Safyaan Sharif.  The ICC and BCCI are working to expedite the process for all 20 teams, with Scotland's opening match on February 7th.  Scotland is also preparing backup visa applications.

title: Bank strike today: Are public sector banks open for customers?
content: Public sector bank operations face nationwide disruption Tuesday as unions strike for a five-day work week. Conciliation talks failed, leading to the strike after banks were already closed for the weekend and Republic Day. This is expected to impact branch services for three consecutive days.

title: Did Anthropic CEO tell Zuckerberg he was wrong to let godfather of AI leave Meta?
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei subtly criticized social media entrepreneurs' approach to AI development, contrasting it with scientists' sense of responsibility. This comes as Meta's AI pioneer Yann LeCun departed following disagreements with Mark Zuckerberg over research direction, particularly concerning world models versus large language models. LeCun's exit and subsequent venture highlight a growing divergence in AI philosophies.

title: ‘Just getting started’: Hardik Pandya shares nostalgic video on 10-year India journey
content: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya celebrated a decade in international cricket, marking the milestone with an emotional message on Instagram. He expressed gratitude for his journey, emphasising that his career is far from over and that he is just beginning his true path. Pandya highlighted his growth as a cricketer and a man while serving his country.

title: ‘Europe financing war against themselves’: India-EU ‘mother of all trade deals’ draws US ire
content: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent targeted the India-EU trade deal, alleging Europe indirectly funds Russia's war by buying refined oil from India, which originates from Russian crude. He pointed out what he called burden-sharing imbalance, contrasting with US tariffs on India for similar trade. The deal aims for broad tariff reductions on goods and services.

title: Infosys to employees: Share data about your electricity bills
content: Infosys is collecting household electricity consumption data from its employees working from home to enhance its sustainability program. This initiative aims to accurately measure the environmental impact of hybrid work and inform future clean energy strategies. The company, a long-time advocate for sustainability, is revalidating its emissions reporting methodology through this employee survey.

title: UGC anti-discrimination rules 2026: A bid for inclusion or risk of bias? Explained
content: Heads of universities and colleges are no longer just administrators; they are now the first line of accountability in preventing and responding to discrimination. New structures, new reporting mechanisms, and strict timelines are written into the rulebook, backed by the threat of serious penalties for non-compliance. Yet, as has often been the case with regulations aimed at correcting long-standing social inequities, the real questions lie beneath the stated intent.

title: Why India-EU FTA is being called the ‘mother of all deals’: Explained in key points
content: India and the European Union are set to sign a landmark Free Trade Agreement after nearly two decades of talks, signaling a significant boost to their economic and strategic partnership.

title: 'Ridiculous': Nvidia CEO fumes over crticism of firm's investments and acquisitions
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismisses claims of 'circular financing' regarding a $2 billion investment in cloud provider CoreWeave. He asserts these are strategic investments in 'generational companies' vital for AI expansion, not financial engineering.  Huang emphasizes Nvidia's contributions are a small fraction of the massive capital these AI firms require for growth.

title: Who is Tom Homan? Trump’s point man sent to Minneapolis as protests erupt over ICE raids
content: US President Trump is sending "tough but fair" border czar Tom Homan to Minneapolis following two fatal shootings involving federal agents. The incidents have intensified protests and calls for an independent investigation into ICE operations, with Homan previously leading aggressive enforcement efforts.

title: ‘Pakistan is provoking Bangladesh’: BCCI VP hits out as PCB delays T20 WC decision
content: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla accused Pakistan of instigating Bangladesh's refusal to play T20 World Cup matches in India, leading to Scotland's inclusion in the tournament. Shukla asserted Bangladesh was assured of security, but Pakistan's "intervention" and "misleading" tactics aggravated the situation. This comes amid Pakistan's own deliberation over participating in the tournament.

title: 'Good luck, keep on dreaming': Nato chief issues blunt warning to Europe on US role
content: Nato secretary general Mark Rutte has said Europe cannot defend itself without the US, dismissing notions of European military independence expressed by many EU leaders. He emphasized the US nuclear umbrella as crucial for freedom and urged European nations to significantly increase defense spending, even suggesting the need for nuclear arms if standing alone.

title: ‘Black law’: Bareilly city magistrate resigns over UGC rules; makes big 'hostage' charge
content: Alankar Agnihotri, a 2019-batch Provincial Civil Service officer, sent his resignation by e-mail to Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and Bareilly District Magistrate Avinash Singh, the officials told news agency PTI. The new rules notified by the UGC on January 13 -- the Promotion of Equity in Higher Education Institutions Regulations, 2026 -- have sparked widespread criticism from general category students who argue that the framework could lead to discrimination against them.

title: Jasprit Bumrah Insurance: India’s pace ace remains the safest bet in T20Is
content: Jasprit Bumrah showcased his exceptional control and wicket-taking ability in the T20 against New Zealand, delivering a match-winning performance. Despite being used in varied roles, Bumrah's spell of 4-0-17-3 restricted the opposition and earned him Player of the Match. The bowler also reflected on his decade-long international career.

title: Robbery in AIIMS Bhopal lift: Woman employee pushed, mangalsutra snatched in seconds
content: A shocking chain snatching incident unfolded within AIIMS Bhopal's lift, targeting a woman employee. A masked assailant, after feigning conversation, forcibly snatched her mangalsutra before fleeing. The lack of security in the lift area and the subsequent escape raise serious questions about the hospital's safety protocols. Investigations are ongoing to identify the perpetrator.

title: Travis Kelce sends mixed retirement signals amid Chiefs coaching shakeup
content: The Kansas City Chiefs star tight end Travis Kelce's decision to withdraw from the 2026 Pro Bowl has intensified speculation about his potential retirement. Despite another strong season, the veteran tight end is seriously weighing his future in the NFL. While official statement has not been release, his sudden  withdrawal from pro move ignited the already heated firestorm

title: Nvidia CEO says 'blue-collar work value will increase': Is AI boom redefining career success?
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang suggests AI will boost blue-collar jobs, challenging traditional career paths.  Historically, advancement meant moving away from hands-on work.  However, the rise of the 'new blue collar' – roles blending physical tasks with AI tools – signifies a shift.  Practical understanding of real-world systems is regaining importance for leadership and career success.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 trades near 25,100; BSE Sensex adds over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmarks, dropped in opening trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,000, BSE Sensex was down over 170 points.

title: ‘We do feel for Bangladesh players’: Scotland admit T20 WC entry was ‘far from ideal’
content: Cricket Scotland's CEO expressed sympathy for Bangladesh after their ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 replacement, acknowledging the unusual circumstances. Bangladesh were removed for refusing to play under the published schedule, a request the ICC denied due to security assurances. Scotland, ranked 14th, step in, despite their own qualification campaign not going as planned.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd, the top stock picks for the trading week (starting January 27, 2026) are ICICI Bank, and Tata Steel. Let’s take a look:

title: Ancient power symbol? India’s longest Iron Age spears unearthed at Tamil Nadu burial site
content: Archaeologists in Tamil Nadu have unearthed an 8ft iron spear, the longest from India's Iron Age, from Thirumalapuram. Found alongside a shorter spear and gold objects in an urn, the find could represent a warrior's weapon or a ceremonial item signifying status. Experts suggest further studies to understand the evolution of iron use in the region.

title: Union Budget 2026: Wishlist for Indian bond investors
content: Union Budget 2026 has the opportunity to send a strong signal: that bonds are not just institutional instruments, but a core part of India’s household investment landscape.

title: Trump hikes tariffs on South Korea to 25%; cites legislative delay in enacting 'historic' trade deal
content: President Trump announced a 25% tariff hike on South Korean autos, lumber, and pharmaceuticals, citing the nation's legislature for failing to ratify their trade agreement. This move follows previous threats and aims to pressure Seoul to uphold the deal, which includes a $350 billion investment pledge.

title: 'Border 2' crosses 200 crore mark, earned Rs 56 crore on Monday
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has set the box office ablaze with its staggering opening, surpassing Rs 50 crore on Monday alone. Riding high on the Republic Day weekend momentum, the film has not only achieved exemplary daily earnings but also amassed a colossal net of Rs 177 crore in just four days.

title: Gurgaon abduction: Woman dragged into Scorpio at 3am, rescued after vehicle gets stuck in mud
content: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, a 23-year-old woman was forcibly taken by a food vendor named Gaurav Bhati from Leopard Trail, who then tried to flee in a Scorpio. As the police launched a high-speed chase across the city, Bhati eventually abandoned the vehicle after it became immobilized. He was apprehended shortly after the attempted escape.

title: India, EU finalise FTA, deal set to be announced today
content: India and the European Union have finalized a comprehensive free trade agreement after 18 years of talks, poised to boost trade and investment. The deal, expected to be announced Tuesday, aims for significant tariff reductions on most goods, with India gaining market access for textiles and leather, while offering concessions on automobiles and wines. Implementation is anticipated by early 2027.

title: MS Dhoni starts preparations ahead of IPL; CSK share practice video - Watch
content: MS Dhoni has commenced batting practice for the upcoming IPL season, with CSK sharing a video of his drills. Despite Ruturaj Gaikwad's form, Dhoni remains a key player as CSK targets a sixth title. His role is under scrutiny following a modest 2025 season and the arrival of Sanju Samson.

title: Kedarnath, Badrinath and 47 affiliated temples considering a ban on entry of non-Hindus
content: Following a proposal to restrict non-Hindus at Haridwar's Kumbh ghats, the Badrinath Kedarnath Temple Committee is considering a similar move at its shrines. Citing tradition and constitutional rights, the committee chairman stated the decision aims to preserve religious practices, welcoming those who respect their faith.

title: On Padma rolls is man who 'exposed' UPA on Ishrat Jahan case
content: A former MHA officer, RVS Mani, instrumental in exposing contradictory affidavits in the Ishrat Jahan case, has been honored with the Padma Shri. Mani claimed political interference led to the revision of the initial affidavit, which cited intelligence reports confirming Jahan's terror links. The second affidavit downplayed the intelligence, a move later confirmed by then Home Minister Rajnath Singh.

title: Wrists working, runs flowing — how Suryakumar Yadav found form again
content: Suryakumar Yadav's recent form with two consecutive fifties has silenced doubts ahead of the T20 World Cup. After a lean patch, a crucial innings in Raipur saw him bat with patience, assessing conditions before unleashing his signature strokeplay. This resurgence provides vital reassurance for the Indian team management.

title: Kolkata: At least 7 killed, 21 missing in massive warehouse fire; probe underway
content: A devastating fire engulfed a Kolkata warehouse complex early Monday, claiming at least seven lives and leaving 21 workers missing. Trapped inside units laden with combustible decoration materials and food supplies, the victims were sleeping when the blaze erupted. Firefighters battled for hours, but the inferno's intensity and smoldering debris continue to hinder rescue efforts.

title: Ex-Olympian Ryan Wedding denies drug kingpin allegations after court appearance
content: Former Olympian Ryan Wedding pleaded not guilty to 17 felony charges during his first US court appearance after his arrest in Mexico. Prosecutors allege he led a major international cocaine operation tied to multiple murders. A judge ordered him held without bond as his attorney rejected comparisons to notorious drug lords.

title: 'United for Kerala elections': Congress leaders likely to meet Shashi Tharoor to settle issues
content: Congress leadership is planning to meet senior leader Shashi Tharoor following his absence from a crucial Kerala election strategy meeting. Tharoor, who cited personal issues and unhappiness with the party, will be invited for discussions to address his grievances. The party aims to ensure unity for the upcoming state elections, recognizing Tharoor's electoral influence.

title: 'Crimes against humanity': Bangladesh sentences ex-Dhaka police chief, 2 officers to death
content: Former Dhaka police chief and two ex-deputies have been sentenced to death by Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal for crimes against humanity. Convicted in absentia, they were found guilty of leading a brutal crackdown on 2024 protests that led to hundreds of deaths and the ouster of then-PM Sheikh Hasina.

title: Travis Kelce romance sparks debate over Taylor Swift’s songwriting
content: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Cooper Kupp’s wife draws reaction in Seahawks coat
content: Cooper Kupp’s NFC Championship appearance against his former Rams blended football and family into one powerful moment. Now with the Seahawks, the Super Bowl MVP faced his past while drawing strength from his wife Anna and their three sons. The matchup symbolized resilience, loyalty, and a fresh chapter driven by purpose.

title: Shedeur Sanders named Pro Bowl replacement QB: Explained
content: Shedeur Sanders has been named to the 2026 Pro Bowl roster. He joins as a replacement quarterback after another player advanced to the Super Bowl. This selection has sparked considerable online discussion. Sanders' rookie season statistics were not considered Pro Bowl caliber. His inclusion highlights the alternate selection process. This marks a significant achievement on his rookie resume.

title: Mass killing of stray dogs continues: 200 more killed in Telangana, toll crosses 1,000 in a month
content: Hundreds of stray dogs were allegedly poisoned to death in Telangana's Hanumakonda district, marking the second mass killing reported this month. Animal rights activists suspect a connection to recent village elections, with officials possibly fulfilling poll promises. Authorities are investigating, with plans to exhume carcasses for post-mortem examinations.

title: Spouse, not husband: Delhi HC orders district courts to use gender-neutral terms
content: Delhi High Court has adopted gender-neutral terminology in court documents, replacing father's/husband's name with parent's/spouse's name. This change, inspired by a district judge's suggestion, aims to empower women and reflect modern family structures. The move will impact judicial officers' personal files, staff ID cards, and various official forms.

title: "Co-Founders Pledged To Donate 80% Of Our Wealth": Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei
content: Many wealthy individuals, especially in the tech industry, view philanthropy as inevitably fraudulent or useless, Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, a leading artificial intelligence company, said, describing this attitude as "cynical and nihilistic."

title: 50 Carcasses Of Migratory Birds Found In Assam District, Poisoning Suspected
content: According to reports, the carcasses were recovered from agricultural fields in the Kamargaon area and nearby localities.

title: India-EU "Mother Of All Deals" Will Boost Manufacturing, Support Services: PM Modi
content: As India and the European Union (EU) move closer to finalising a landmark free-trade agreement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the move, saying the trade pact will boost the manufacturing sector and support services.

title: Who Was Ran Gvili, 24-Year-Old Cop & Last Israeli Hostage To Return From Gaza
content: Ran Gvili, a young Israeli police officer, was on medical leave when Hamas launched its deadly attack on Israel on October 7, 2023. Instead of staying home, the 24-year-old grabbed his gun and raced toward the area of the attack in southern Israel

title: Son Of Jharkhand Industrialist, Kidnapped On January 13, Recovered Safely
content: Kairav Gandhi, the 24-year-old son of well-known Jamshedpur businessman Devang Gandhi, who was abducted 14 days ago, has been rescued safely from the clutches of his kidnappers, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Woman, 24, Dies By Suicide In Bengaluru Over Dowry-Related Harassment
content: A 24-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide by hanging at her residence in southern Bengaluru, reportedly due to dowry-related harassment, police said on Tuesday.

title: Madhya Pradesh Government School Students Served Republic Day Meal On Torn Book Pages
content: Funds had already been released for purchasing plates according to student strength. Yet, on Republic Day, not a single plate was seen.

title: Grok AI Mistranslates PM's Maldives Post, Inserts "Anti-India Campaigns"
content: The India-Maldives relationship has seen periods of tension in recent times, making such erroneous and inflammatory "translation" particularly sensitive.

title: Experts Warn Of Rising AI-Generated Holocaust Images Threatening History
content: An emaciated and apparently blind man stands in the snow at the Nazi concentration camp of Flossenbuerg: the image seems real at first but is part of a wave of AI-generated content about the Holocaust.

title: "Crackdown Gone Too Far": Approval Of Trump's Immigration Policy Hits New Low
content: American approval of US President Donald Trump's immigration policy fell to its lowest level since his return to the White House in a new Reuters/Ipsos poll, with a majority of Americans saying his crackdown on immigration has gone too far.

title: Andhra Woman, Lover Arrested Days After Killing Husband With Poisoned Biryani
content: A post-mortem examination revealed internal injuries and signs of violent assault, confirming that it was a case of homicide and not natural death.

title: Ex-Army Officer On Wheelchair Alleges "Humiliation" At Karnataka Toll
content: Retired Army Commander Shyamaraj said that the toll staff allegedly refused to grant toll exemption despite him producing relevant documents.

title: India-EU Summit 2026 LIVE: PM Modi Hails India-EU Trade Pact As "Mother Of All Deals"
content: India-EU Summit LIVE Updates: India and the EU have concluded negotiations on the much-awaited Free Trade Agreement (FTA), and the announcement of the conclusion of talks will be made at the 16th India-EU Summit.

title: New Zealand's Maori Tribals Perform Haka At Jatara Festival In Telangana
content: In a unique cultural exchange, tribal representatives from New Zealand's Maori community visited the historic Sammakka-Saralamma Jatara in Telangana's Medaram and enlivened the celebrations with Haka dance

title: Canada, India Pledge To Grow Oil, Petroleum Trade In Energy Reset
content: Canada and India will pledge to expand trade in oil and gas as the countries reboot their relationship after a diplomatic chill.

title: EU And India Conclude Trade Talks, Seeking Trump Alternatives
content: The European Union and India are set to announce an agreement on a long-awaited trade deal on Tuesday, forging closer economic ties to hedge against US President Donald Trump's tariffs.

title: US Official Denies Report Gregory Bovino Was Removed From Border Patrol Post
content: The Department of Homeland Security denied a report Monday that US Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino had been removed from his post, despite President Donald Trump reassessing harsh immigration crackdown tactics

title: Over 1,200 Roads Closed In Himachal Pradesh Due To Snowfall
content: Heavy snowfall and rain across Himachal Pradesh have led to the closure of more than 1,250 roads, severely disrupting normal life across the hill state.

title: Deadly Minneapolis Raids Put Trump's Immigration Crackdown Under Fire
content: Donald Trump's immigration crackdown across the United States is the signature issue of his second term -- but deadly violence in Minneapolis risks making it a liability for a president who already looks vulnerable in the polls.

title: PM Modi announces signing of India-EU Free Trade Agreement
content: People are discussing it as a "mother of all deals”, and this agreement has brought a lot of opportunities for 140 crore Indians and crores of Europeans, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Elderly man beaten to death over ‘witchcraft’ suspicion in Jharkhand’s Palamu
content: “The incident occurred at Chhanka village in Manatu police station area on January 26, said. The deceased has been identified as Faguni Bhuiyan,” says police

title: Indian Oil to raise Brazilian crude purchases as Russian imports slow, executive says
content: Indian refiners are considering importing Venezuelan crude, which is being offered by Vitol and Trafigura under a ⁠U.S. mandated sale

title: 200 more stray dogs killed in Telangana’s Pathipaka village
content: A complaint lodged on Monday alleges the dogs were killed about a month ago. The latest complaint was included with the FIR already registered over deaths of 300 stray dogs in two Hanamkonda villages.

title: China halts sale of Sun Pharma drug used to treat dementia
content: The National Medical Products ​Administration said a recent remote ⁠inspection found shortcomings in the company’s production processes, including in the ​prevention of ⁠contamination anfulfilmentd the quality management department’s fulfillment of duties.

title: Jana Nayagan censor row: Madras High Court sets aside single judge’s order in favour of actor Vijay’s film
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan remand the matter back to the single judge for a fresh hearing of the writ petition

title: CPI(M) in Kerala expels V. Kunhikrishnan over martyrs’ fund allegations
content: CPI(M) Kannur district secretary K.K. Ragesh says Kunhikrishnan has “acted as a tool in the hands of party enemies” by repeating issues that had already been settled by the district committee in April 2022

title: Political tensions rise in Kerala’s Payyannur as motorcycle linked to V. Kunhikrishnan’s supporter set ablaze amid protests
content: The incident comes a day after Kunhikrishnan was expelled from CPI(M) over allegations related to irregularities in martyrs’ fund

title: T.N. govt. scheme improves access to diabetes, hypertension care for women, rural residents: study
content: The State-wide cross-sectional household survey was conducted across all 38 districts to evaluate the reach and effectiveness of services provided under Makkalai Thedi Maruthuvam, an initiative that delivers home-based screening and care for NCDs

title: Kerala Assembly reconvenes amid UDF protest over Sabarimala gold row; two MLAs launch satyagraha seeking Minister’s resignation
content: V.D. Satheesan announces that MLAs C.R. Mahesh and Najeeb Kanthapuram will begin a satyagraha in front of the Assembly and says Opposition will pursue the protest while continuing to cooperate with House proceedings

title: Man held for kidnapping and alleged rape attempt in Gurugram
content: A police team arrived on the scene and managed to thwart the rape attempt, apprehending the suspect along with his vehicle, according to a senior police officer.

title: Third row seats for Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul; Congress says Leaders of Opposition insulted
content: Sharing pictures of their leaders seated in the back rows during the ceremony, several Congress leaders raised questions over the "protocol mess-up" and propriety

title: Bandepalya rowdy-sheeter Shabbir murder: 11 accused arrested, KCOCA to be invoked by Bengaluru police
content: Police said the murder was the result of a long-standing dispute involving extortion and a civil property issue between the accused and the deceased

title: 50 flights to and from Srinagar cancelled due to snowfall
content: "In view of adverse weather conditions and continuing snowfall at Srinagar Airport, airlines have cancelled certain flights for today," says an official of the Airport Authority of India

title: BJP alleges arson bid at 'Bharat Mata' pandal in West Bengal; police suspect short-circuit
content: TMC goons in the area set the pandal on fire late Saturday night and fled, but timely action by local people and our supporters prevented further damage. Police took no action so far, alleges Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar

title: Bareilly Magistrate suspended for indiscipline, faces inquiry amid resignation row
content: Mr. Agnihotri, a 2019-batch Provincial Civil Service officer, had tendered his resignation on Republic Day, citing deep disagreement with government policies, especially the new UGC regulations, which he claimed could foment caste-based discontent and vitiate the academic environment

title: Accused involved in hurling country bomb on police team killed in encounter in Perambalur
content: “Alaguraja attacked Sub Inspector Shankar with a weapon, causing injury to the latter. The Inspector opened one round of fire on Alaguraja in an act of defence. Alaguraja died on the way to the hospital,” says police

title: People don’t perceive U.N. as organisation that delivers on international peace, security: India
content: India said the international rule of law should not be weaponised to question state sovereignty and interfere in the internal affairs of states

title: Not normal to tolerate Pakistan’s continued use of terror as instrument of state policy: India
content: India’s Permanent Representative to the U.N., Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish, delivered a sharp response to comments made by Pakistan’s Ambassador to the U.N., Asim Iftikhar Ahmad

title: Fisherfolk oppose Mamallan Reservoir project at Gram Sabhas
content: According to a community leader, people from Kanathur Reddikuppam, Kovalam, and Nemmeli submitted petitions stating that their livelihoods would be lost if the reservoir is established

title: Uttarakhand implements UCC amendment ordinance
content: Uttarakhandbeen made for the issuance of a termination certificate by the registrar upon the end of a live-in relationship and to replace the term “widow” with “spouse”, officials said.

title: Actor Mimi Chakraborty alleges harassment during stage performance, lodges police complaint
content: The club authorities further alleged misconduct by the actress’s security personnel, claiming that her bodyguards forcibly removed women members of the club who were present on the stage to felicitate her at the start of the programme

title: ‘Why didn’t you mention Dr. Ambedkar’s name’, angry forest guard asks Maharashtra cabinet Minister during Republic Day event
content: Forest guard seeks a case against him under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act

title: Rahul ‘insulted’ northeast by not wearing Gamosa at reception hosted by President: BJP
content: Congress counters the charge by pointing out that Defence Minister Rajnath Singh had also not worn the ‘patka’

title: Madhya Pradesh village ‘declares’ social, economic boycott of families whose members marry by choice; probe on
content: The man lists out further restrictions on the families, including the supply of milk or any other products, leasing their fields for farming, and any priests, barbers or any other service provider giving services to those families.

title: Banking operations to be hit on January 27 as unions to go on strike seeking five-day work week
content: With banks remaining closed on January 25 and January 26 (Republic Day), the strike on January 27 will result in a disruption of branch-level services for three consecutive days

title: SWR achieves gross revenue of ₹6,939 crore in first three quarters
content: Under various work heads, 190 projects worth ₹1,107 crore were sanctioned, and 109 projects costing ₹2,264 crore were shortlisted, including several RoB/RuB works.

title: Kalaburagi Next Foundation launched to drive district’s holistic development
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj, IT-BT Minister and Kalaburagi district in-charge Priyank Kharge on Monday launched the Kalaburagi Next Foundation, a government-supported public charitable trust aimed at promoting inclusive and sustainable development of the district through public participation and corporate collaboration.

title: Uproar intensifies against new UGC equity regulations
content: Writ petition filed in Supreme Court challenging 2026 UGC regulations; students’ union in Kumaun University submits letter opposing it

title: Census 2027 | Caste methodology yet to be decided, clarity likely by July
content: Opposition parties such as the Congress and Samajwadi Party had questioned BJP-led Union government over absence of expanded caste column in the questionnaire of the first phase of Census published last week; however, officials say caste will be enumerated only in the second and final phase

title: ‘Failed’ NDA was restored out of compulsion and blackmail, says  Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
content:
This is merely a cosmetic attempt to give the alliance a fresh build-up. Parties have joined the NDA owing to pressure
from Central government agencies, he says at ‘Vellum Tamizh Pengal’ delta zone-level DMK women’s wing conference

title: Raut slams Padma Bhushan honour for Koshyari, accuses him of toppling Uddhav govt.
content: The Rajya Sabha MP says even the Supreme Court had said Koshyari acted illegally during his tenure as Governor

title: PM Modi thanks leaders of France, Bhutan, Cyprus for Republic Day greetings
content: “Thank you my dear friend President Emmanuel Macron for your warm wishes on India’s 77th Republic Day. I look forward to welcoming you in India soon and further deepening and diversifying the India-France strategic partnership,” Mr. Modi said in response to French President Emmanuel Macron’s wishes

title: India displays military might, cultural pride at Kartavya Path
content: President leads ceremony marked by gaiety and patriotic fervour; Ashoka Chakra conferred on Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla; armed forces showcase weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor; IAF flypast features Rafales, Sukhois, MiGs

title: R-Day flower show at Lalbagh records over 8 lakh visitors, generates ₹2.75 crore
content: Last year’s Republic Day flower show at Lalbagh, themed on Adikavi Maharshi Valmiki, had recorded a total footfall of 4.75 lakh visitors

title: Seven feared dead, several missing in massive Kolkata warehouse fire
content: More than 20 people feared trapped inside the warehouse gutted in the fire; no official confirmation of casualties issued by the administration till late Monday, January 26, evening

title: Public urged to work together for development of NTR district
content: A plan is being implemented to achieve an annual growth rate of 18.5% across all sectors in the district, says Lakshmisha during the Republic Day celebrations at IGMC Stadium

title: Indians abroad celebrate Republic Day; greetings pour in from world leaders
content: Extending his wishes, U.S. President Trump says 'U.S.-India share historic bond'; Chinese President Xi says India-China relations continue to improve and develop, aligning with the fundamental interests of both countries and their people

title: Vande Mataram tableaux at the Republic Day parade
content: The notes of the national song rang clear as the Culture Ministry’s tableau, themed around ‘Vande Mataram: Swatantrata ka Mantra (freedom chant)’, rolled out on Kartavya Path

title: Constitution is protective shield for citizen rights, says Rahul Gandhi on 77th Republic Day
content: Congress leaders criticise the government for not offering front row seats to the Leaders of Opposition in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha during the Republic Day parade

title: Long march to Mumbai: Protesters march towards Mumbai, refuse to stop without meeting CM
content: Delegation to meet Ministers and officials in Mumbai on January 27; at the heart of the protest is the high rate of rejections of land ownership claims under the Forest Rights Act, and other issues pertaining to its implementation

title: Sidlaghatta civic official threat case: Congress leader Rajeev Gowda arrested at Kerala border
content: He is accused of abusing and threatening the Sidlaghatta municipal commissioner over the phone. The conversation went viral and led to public outrage

title: Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s second term
content: Constitutional amendments granting higher representation to SC,ST, OBC and women passed Parliament since 2019

title: GBA chief orders immediate work on Ejipura flyover, mark St. John’s land
content: The instructions were given during a meeting with traffic police and representatives of St. John’s Hospital to resolve land-related issues affecting the progress of the flyover project in Bengaluru

title: Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s first term
content: Judicial, tax, foreign reforms took centre stage in Modi’s first term, before reservation caught up by in 2019

title: BMRCL begins beautification drive under Pink Line on Bannerghatta Road
content: BMRCL has confirmed that the much-anticipated Pink Line corridor will be opened in phases by September 2026. The 7.5-km elevated section from Tavarekere to Kalena Agrahara, running along Bannerghatta Road, is expected to be commissioned by March 2026

title: Furniture store fire tragedy in Nampally mirrors last year’s disaster near Gulzar Houz
content: “The glass was thick and did not break easily, that’s why the firefighting operation took so long. Then they drilled the hole near the ramp,” says a furniture-store worker

title: Canadian PM Mark Carney likely to visit India in early March, India’s envoy to Canada says
content: Formal negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with India should also start in March, India’s ​High Commissioner to Canada Dinesh Patnaik says

title: All set for annual celestial wedding at Antarvedi temple in Konaseema
content: The devotees will take part in the procession of the chariot on January 29 and take holy dip the next day in the confluence point of Godavari into sea at Antarvedi

title: EU-India FTA talks conclude, summit on January 27
content: A “balanced, forward-looking deal” negotiated, says govt.; EU chief Ursula von der Leyen says India and Europe will work to “shape new global order”

title: Parents among five arrested for selling newborn girl in Chamarajanagar for ₹50,000
content: When the Child Development Project Officer of Chamarajanagar noticed that the newborn girl was not in her parents’ custody, a complaint was lodged with the Chamarajanagar Town Police Station on September 15, 2025

title: Naidu pushes for technology-driven governance, names 2026 decision-making year
content: Chief Minister stresses use of AI and digital tools to reduce field staff workload, speed up grievance redressal and improve service delivery across departments

title: Godavari Delta to be surveyed at cost of over ₹13 crore
content: Eight pacts signed to attract ₹58,850 crore investments in Kakinada district during CII-Visakhapatnam summit-2025; A fleet of 50 EV buses to be deployed in East Godavari by 2026 end

title: Stonehenge mystery solved? Study reveals how 25-tonne stones reached the site

title: MLS, Polymarket join forces in prediction markets
content: the NHL became the first major professional U.S. league to announce a deal with prediction markets in October last year . prediction markets such as Polymarket and Kalshi allow users to trade on the yes/no outcome of events .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: South Carolina slips
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the results of a pair of SEC showdowns shuffled the top of the rankings . south Carolina Gamecocks dropped one spot to no. 3 .

title: ⚾ MLB breakout teams: Who's better in 2026?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .

title: Super Bowl betting buzz: How one bettor's $100 bet could turn into $310,000
content: our super bowl betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories leading up to the big game . the matchup for super Bowl LX is set with the Seattle Seahawks favored over the new England Patriots to take home the Lombardi Trophy .

title: Bracketology watch guide: Duke's chance to be No. 1 overall, plus big weekend moves
content: we provide inside look at the headlines and upcoming matchups that inform Joey Brackets' calculations on any given night . this page will update every day around lunchtime, between Tuesday and Saturday to start . a team's projection on that day is 68 for the 2026 NCAA tournament .

title: UCLA's Bob Chesney: Coal miner, bartender, coach of the Bruins
content: new coach Bob Chesney has mined coal, slung Red Bull and vodkas behind a bar . he has worked every on-field job from strength coach to special teams coach . "he's the kind of guy I want to get in the foxhole with," athletic director says .

title: The two sides of Mitch Marner's return home to Toronto
content: the Toronto Maple Leafs honor Mitch Marner in a tribute video . the star player spent nine seasons with the team . he left his hometown team and joined the Vegas Golden Knacks . marner's car was stolen and his address was leaked online .

title: After Clippers' 15-3 run, fan follows through on eating his words
content: the LA Clippers defeated the Brooklyn Nets 126-89 on a 15-3 stretch dating back to December . fans remembered Flom's post on X as soon as the final buzzer sounded . he stayed true to his word, saying he would indeed eat a printout of his post .
